personalInfo.clubAffl: Club de Golf Los Leones (Santiago, Chile)

tourBios.curYrHigh: Earned PGA TOUR Latinoamérica status by finishing T10 at the Argentina Q-School in January… Was the only player to card four rounds in the 60s at the season opening Avianca Colombia Open, an event he finished five-shots behind Justin Hueber to claim runner-up honors in February.
tourBios.carHigh: 2015: Playing on a sponsor exemption, only two weeks after turning pro, he finished T4 at the Hyundai-BBVA 89º Abierto de Chile on his first career start on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica. Got in contention after carding a 9-under 63 on the third round… Collected another PGA TOUR Latinoamérica top-10 at the Mundo Maya Open (T9)… Made the cut in all of his five Tour starts, collecting three top-25s to finish 69th on the Order of Merit.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played one year of college golf at Texas Tech (2014-15 season), before deciding to turn pro… His highest rank as an amateur was No. 5 on the World Amateur Golf Ranking in August of 2015.
tourBios.personal: Twitter name is @Mitopereira… Instagram name is @mito_pereira
tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 2-11 at 2016 Q-School (exempt to midseason reshuffle)

tourBios.curYearHigh: Earned PGA TOUR Latinoamérica status by finishing T10 at the Argentina Q-School in January… Was the only player to card four rounds in the 60s at the season opening Avianca Colombia Open, an event he finished five-shots behind Justin Hueber to claim runner-up honors in February.

dyn.dynBios: Before turning pro he got to be ranked No. 5 on the Amateur World Ranking in August 2015.
dyn.dynResults: His best finish on PGA TOUR Latinoamérica has been runner-up at the 69th Avianca Colombia Open (2016)
